info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 8:25PM EDT until June 28 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Virginia, including the following county, Bath.
* WHEN...Until 1215 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 820 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has ended, leaving only areas of light to occasionally moderate rain. However, minor flooding is likely ongoing in the advisory area due to between 1.5 and locally 3 inches of rain that fell earlier this evening. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Jackson River, Falling Spring Creek, Brushy Lick, Cedar Creek, Dry Run, Chimney Run, Hoover Creek and Back Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Warm Springs... Hot Springs... Mountain Grove... Bacova Junction... Lake Moomaw... Callison... Carloover... - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EDT SATURDAY
